data.text: Nice option to get some sleep between two flights! Cozy little room, climatized but a little bit expensive in my opinion. Also you can hear the other peoples alarms, but in the room are esrplugs, if you donâ€™t bring your own. I would do it again.
data.title: Nice to get some sleep

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear C8139WNluisp,

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We are delighted to hear that you found our sleep option convenient and cozy. We appreciate your comments regarding the pricing and the noise level, and we will consider them for future improvements. 

We are glad to know that you would consider staying with us again. Your satisfaction is our top priority, and we hope to provide you with an even better experience on your next visit. 

Thank you once again for choosing us for your layover accommodation.

Best regards,

The Lounge Team
owner_response.author: Rebecca S

data.text:
Sleep and fly is brilliant for resting during longer connections. I had over 10 hours of connecting flight. Pre-booked the sleep and fly facilities for 10 hours. There are 3 packages 7am-1pm, 1pm-11pm and 11pm-7am. Very reasonably priced. 
They have single or double cabins. You can also book per hour I believe which I have not tried and cannot comment on. 

The sleep cabin I booked comprised of an electronically controlled chair that turned into a single bed. There is ample space to place a cabin bag and an additional rucksack. The cabin offers charging points and AC and a folding table tray. Very convenient facility to put your head down and catchup on sleep or rest comfortably. 

The toilet facilities are right outside the entrance to the sleep and fly at Concourse C but no showers. The sleep and fly at Concourse B, Terminal 3 offers shower facilities. Please bring your own toiletry and towels. There are free showers near B17 Gate. 

Overall highly recommended for longer stopovers for connecting flights. 
Please note this is for Transit ONLY.  

Ask the staff to lock the cabin if you want to browse around the airport duty free or get a bite to eat. 
Very helpful staff.
data.title: Excellent rest haven

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear WorldExplorer08,

Thank you very much for your very positive evaluation.

We are happy to know that you enjoyed our service. Your feedback is very helpful for travelers having layovers at Dubai International Airport.

We look forward to welcoming you again soon and sharing a better experience.

Best regards,

The Lounge Team

data.text:
Super accommodating staff at reception. Walked in to try our luck as i forgot to book in advance, and we had a 9h layover. Ronie and Topher accommodated us and were very helpful! 

Room size is conducive for sleep, clean and cool. There are blankets, pillows other amenities. Great place!
data.title: Best Staff!

owner_response.author: Rebecca S

data.text:
Having 4.5 hours between flights we decided to book a Sleep 'N fly cabin at Terminal 3 in the middle of the C-Gates where our flight also was continuing. Check-in was easy and we really could get a good rest, the cabins being nearly soundproof. Relaxation is better than in the paid lounges. The only downside was the toilet, it's the public toilet out on the terminal you have to go to. Our departing gate was just minutes away.

Obviously a lot of reviews in this section are referring to a different Sleep 'N fly at the airport as there are several in terminal 3 and in other terminals too. So check the webpage thoroughly to get what you expect.

I would book a Sleep 'N fly cabin anytime again also for quite a short stay of only a couple of hours. It's worth having your own space and some silence in the hustle and bustle of the airport. You have got everything you need and it's clean.
data.title: Better than a paid lounge

data.text:
Tried staying here for my long layover in Dubai. I got the solo sleeping pod, but they also have couple rooms and family rooms. 

Private pod was cozy, got to nap well. Shared ladies restroom and shower rooms were clean, good quality of supplies too (soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, towels, etc). You could step out and get a snack or meal from the airport, have it in your room. Thereâ€™s a small foldable table too. Charging station in the pod for gadgets. Unlimited coffee, water, and soda!

Best of all, 5-star service from fellow Filipinos who assisted me all throughout!

If youâ€™re ever in Dubai or Doha, and you have a long layover, try Sleep n Fly! ðŸ’¯ðŸ’¯ðŸ’¯
data.title: Clean, comfortable, 5-star service, value for money
